an4.43:4.1: “Mendicants, these four people are found in the world.
an4.43:4.3: People who value anger, or denigration, or material possessions, or honor rather than the true teaching.
an4.43:4.4: These are the four people found in the world.
an4.43:5.1: These four people are found in the world.
an4.43:5.3: People who value the true teaching rather than anger, or denigration, or material possessions, or honor.
an4.43:5.4: These are the four people found in the world.”
an4.43:6.4: that was taught by the perfect Buddha.
an4.43:7.1: But those who value the true teaching,
an4.43:7.2: who have lived it, and are living it now,
an4.43:7.3: these do grow in the teaching
an4.43:7.4: that was taught by the perfect Buddha.”
